text: in today's world your applications must
evolve quickly to meet your customers
needs improving and releasing software
at a fast pace to meet customer needs is
at the core of every successful business
making agility and time to Market
essential to maintaining your
competitive Advantage companies that can
rapidly deliver updates innovate faster
adapt to changing markets more easily
and drive better business results but
quickly delivering updates such as new
features or bug fixes can be difficult
and error prone using tradition software
release processes where code updates are
manually and infrequently moved from
development to testing and finally to
production what if the entire software
release process were automated allowing
you to test and release code more
frequently introducing AWS code pipeline
a continuous delivery service for fast
and reliable application updates with
continuous delivery your code updates
are automatically built tested and made
ready to deploy code pipeline lets you
model visualize and automate your
software release process through a simpl
to use graphical user interface or with
a command line interface you model your
software release process as a workflow
made of different stages or a pipeline
which describes how new code changes
progress through your release process at
each stage you choose the actions that
are performed on your code such as how
and where your code is built tested and
deployed when your pipeline is active
every code change made to your Source
repository is automatically pushed
through the set of actions you defined
so that code updates are run through a
standardized process after every commit
code pipeline lets you set manual
approvals at each stage of your pipeline
so that approvers can review and then
approve or reject updates before they
progress down your pipeline code
pipeline also automatically stops your
pipeline whenever an action fails such
as a unit test failure this automation
allows you to test your code more
frequently and catch bugs while they are
small and simple to fix once your
release process has been automated it
becomes easier to build test and deploy
updates more frequently this allows you
to focus on improving your core product
code pipeline is extensible and works
with a variety of source code build
testing and deployment tools from AWS or
third parties enabling you to use
different services in each stage of your
pipeline for example you can use AWS
code commit as your Source repository or
AWS code deploy for automated code
deployments to your instances code
pipeline allows you to invoke custom
logic using AWS Lambda during any stage
of your pipeline you can also use
popular thirdparty developer tools via
pre-built plugins or create your own
custom plugins and actions enabling you
to customize your pipeline to meet your
specific needs code pipeline uses AWS
identity and access management to manage
who can make changes to your release
workflow keeping your software release
pipeline secure with code pipeline you
only pay per active pipeline per month
there are no upfront fees and no setup
costs get started on AWS code Pipeline
with a few clicks in the AWS Management
console
